channel.title: Thoughts from Anala
channel.description: Recent content on Thoughts from Anala

item.title: On my favourite R packages
item.description: R is the statistical programming language I have used for a number of years in school and work. One reason I have enjoyed using R (particularly over SAS, but comparably to Python) is the large number of packages available for download to enhance the scope of analyses. There are a number of packages I always load when starting an analysis: Everything in the tidyverse: the tidyverse includes packages that simplify data manipulation, data cleaning, data summarisation, and graphical representation of data.

item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Anala Gossai and I am a Quantitative Biomedical Scientist by education and practice. I specialize in deriving and communicating actionable insights from real-world health data using rigorous statistical methods.

item.title: On starting a blog
item.description: I spent a weekend building this static website that could host simple markdown documents or HTML outputs. Although I have some familiarity with using Jekyll as a static site generator with GitHub Pages, I preferred the default aesthetics of Hugo with the Casper theme. Thus, I started following the Quick Start guide for building and deploying Hugo as a GitHub Pages website. I did, however, make the following adjustments as I proceeded through the guides and help pages:

item.title: Contact
item.description: Please e-mail me at anala.gossai@gmail.com. I am also present on LinkedIn.
